paragraphs.title: Imports
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
import numpy as np
import StringIO
import pandas as pd
import csv, math, re, time, unicodedata

from nltk.corpus import stopwords
from nltk.stem.porter import PorterStemmer

from pyspark import SparkContext
from pyspark import Row
from pyspark.sql import SQLContext
from pyspark.ml.feature import Word2Vec, Word2VecModel
from pyspark.ml.clustering import KMeans
from pyspark.mllib.linalg import Vectors
from pyspark.ml.feature import PCA

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from mpl_toolkits.mplot3d import Axes3D

import word2vecUtilities as wvu

%pyspark

from nltk.stem.porter import PorterStemmer
from nltk.stem.lancaster import LancasterStemmer
from nltk.stem import SnowballStemmer
from nltk.stem import WordNetLemmatizer

porter_stemmer = PorterStemmer()
lancaster_stemmer = LancasterStemmer()
snowball_stemmer = SnowballStemmer("english")
wordnet_lemmatizer = WordNetLemmatizer()



def printStemOptions(w):
    print "Word:        " + w + "*"
    print "Porter:      " + porter_stemmer.stem(w)
    print "Lancaster:   " + lancaster_stemmer.stem(w)
    print "Snowball:    " + snowball_stemmer.stem(w)
    print "Lemmatizer:  " + wordnet_lemmatizer.lemmatize(w)
    print "LemmatizerV: " + wordnet_lemmatizer.lemmatize(w, pos="v")
    print "   "

printStemOptions("substances")
printStemOptions("controlled")
printStemOptions("crying")
printStemOptions("misdemeanor")
paragraphs.title: Stemmer testing
Prepare and clean data
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
#Sometimes this has to be run twice...

porter_stemmer = PorterStemmer()


#pa_name = "tax_law"
#pa_name = "education_law"
pa_name = "criminal_law_and_procedure"
docletRdd = sc.textFile("/vagrant/data/"+pa_name+"_doclets.csv")
asciiRdd = docletRdd.map(lambda text: unicodedata.normalize('NFD', text).encode('ascii', 'ignore'))
docletDF = asciiRdd.mapPartitions(lambda x: csv.reader(x)).toDF()

def parseAndRemoveStopWords(text):
    t = re.sub("[^a-z]", " ", text[1].lower())
    t = re.sub("\s+", " ", t)
    t = t.split(" ")
    stop = stopwords.words('english')
    #return [porter_stemmer.stem(i) for i in t if i not in stop]
    return [i for i in t if i not in stop]

dw = docletDF.map(parseAndRemoveStopWords)
dwDF = dw.map(lambda p: Row(text=p)).toDF()

z.show(dwDF.take(2))

result.msg: [Row(text=[u'manufactur', u'control', u'counterfeit', u'substanc', u'control', u'substanc', u'analog', u'prohibit', u'except', u'author', u'control', u'substanc', u'relat', u'offens', u'unlaw', u'person', u'knowingli', u'manufactur', u'deliv', u'possess', u'intent', u'manufactur', u'deliv', u'control', u'substanc', u'methamphetamin', u'counterfeit', u'substanc', u'control', u'substanc', u'analog', u'violat', u'control', u'substanc', u'relat', u'offens', u'respect', u'control', u'substanc', u'list', u'herein', u'constitut', u'singl', u'separ', u'violat', u'control', u'substanc', u'relat', u'offens', u'']), Row(text=[u'neb', u'rev', u'stat', u'cum', u'supp', u'unlaw', u'person', u'knowingli', u'intent', u'manufactur', u'distribut', u'deliv', u'dispens', u'possess', u'intent', u'manufactur', u'distribut', u'deliv', u'dispens', u'control', u'substanc', u''])]

paragraphs.title: Create a new model or Load an old model
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

t0 = time.time()
w2vModel = Word2Vec(vectorSize=100, minCount=5, inputCol="text", outputCol="result").fit(dwDF)
print "Elapsed time (seconds) to train Word2Vec: ", time.time() - t0

modelpath = "/vagrant/FileStore/models/w2v_"+pa_name

#w2vModel.save(sc, modelpath)
# w2vModel = Word2VecModel.load(sc, modelpath)

paragraphs.title: Word Cloud
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

from wordcloud import WordCloud, STOPWORDS
def show(p):
    img = StringIO.StringIO()
    p.savefig(img, format='svg')
    img.seek(0)
    print '%html ' + img.buf
    print 'hello'

words = " ".join([x[0] for x in synonyms for times in range(0, int(x[1]*10))])

wordcloud = WordCloud(#font_path='/usr/share/fonts/some.ttf',
                            stopwords=STOPWORDS,
                            background_color='white',
                            width=1800,
                            height=1400
                           ).generate(words)
plt.clf()
plt.imshow(wordcloud)
plt.axis('off')
show(plt)

paragraphs.title: PCA on Top of Word2Vec using DF (spark.ml)
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

dfW2V = wordVectorsDF.select('vector').withColumnRenamed('vector','features')

numComponents = 3
pca = PCA(k = numComponents, inputCol = 'features', outputCol = 'pcaFeatures')
model = pca.fit(dfW2V)
dfComp = model.transform(dfW2V).select("pcaFeatures")

paragraphs.title: 3D Visualization - Helper
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

# A helper function for rendering plots to browser
import StringIO
def show(p):
  img = StringIO.StringIO()
  p.savefig(img, format='svg')
  img.seek(0)
  print '%html ' + img.buf

paragraphs.title: 3D Visualization (fraud)
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

word = 'fraud'
nwords = 25

#############

r = wvu.topNwordsToPlot(dfComp,wordVectorsDF,word,nwords)

############
fs=20 #fontsize
w = r['word']
fig = plt.figure()
ax = fig.add_subplot(111, projection='3d')

height = 10
width = 10
fig.set_size_inches(width, height)

ax.scatter(r['X'], r['Y'], r['Z'], color='red', s=100, marker='o', edgecolors='black')
for i, txt in enumerate(w):
    if(i<7):
        ax.text(r['X'].ix[i],r['Y'].ix[i],r['Z'].ix[i], '%s' % (txt), size=20, zorder=1, color='k')
ax.set_xlabel('1st. Component', fontsize=fs)
ax.set_ylabel('2nd. Component', fontsize=fs)
ax.set_zlabel('3rd. Component', fontsize=fs)
ax.set_title('Visualization of Word2Vec via PCA', fontsize=fs)
ax.grid(True)

# Use helper to render to browser
show(plt)

paragraphs.title: K-means on top of Word2Vec using DF (spark.ml)
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

t0=time.time()

K = int(math.floor(math.sqrt(float(vocabSize)/2)))
         # K ~ sqrt(n/2) this is a rule of thumb for choosing K,
         # where n is the number of words in the model
         # feel free to choose K with a fancier algorithm
         
dfW2V = wordVectorsDF.select('vector').withColumnRenamed('vector','features')
kmeans = KMeans(k=K, seed=1)
modelK = kmeans.fit(dfW2V)
labelsDF = modelK.transform(dfW2V).select('prediction').withColumnRenamed('prediction','labels')

print "Number of Clusters (K) Used: ", K
print "Elapsed time (seconds) :", time.time() - t0
